doc.field: Schroeder comments on crisis in Iraq

German Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder has said that Saddam Hussein should be made aware of the consequences of renewed provocation. Mr. Schroeder said that Mr. Hussein should immediately cooperate fully with the United Stations,without any preconditions. Joschka Fischer, Minister of Foreign Affairs, plans to working towards persuading the international community to lift sanctions against Iraq.

The latest round "Alliance for Work" talks were resumed again today. This round of meetings together with representatives from the government and employer and employee associations was chaired by Mr. Hombach, Minister for the Chancellor's Office. A so-called steering committee whose task it will be to coordinate top-level talks, is to resume its function. The next round of top-level talks will take place at the end of February. Bernhard Jagoda, president for the Federal Labour Office, predicts that unemployment numbers can be reduced by one million unemployed over the next four years.
Struck admits that government has made mistakes

Mr. Struck, parliamentary leader of the SPD, has admitted that the current coalition govermernt have made mistakes. He said to the daily newspaper "Die Welt" that the artificial time pressure they had set themselves was responsible for this. According to Mr. Struck, "the motor is just beginning to run smoothly". The Green and SPD parliamentary factions have to learn that the government should no longer be attacked, but rather supported, continued Mr. Struck.
Ruhrgas AG purchases shares in Russian gas monopoly

The German gas company, Ruhrgas AG, has purchased shares in the Russian gas monopoly, Gasprom. Representatives of both concerns will sign the contract in Moscow on Monday. Ruhrgas will pay over a billion marks for 2,5 percent of Gasprom shares. The company, based in Essen, is Gasprom's largest client. The two concerns had signed an agreement only in May that Gasprom will continue to supply Ruhrgas with 25 billion marks worth of gas until the year 2020.
Germany for communal EU strategy in dealing with Russia

The German government plans to implement a communal EU strategy in dealing with Russia in their period of EU presidency. The new program will be organised according to a program of points and a list on concrete expectations as far as Russian foreign politics is concerned. Other points are food aid, advice in the banking sector and closer cooperation in specific regions.
Poppe: no more refugees to be deported to Algeria

Mr. Poppe, the German government's special representative for human rights, has demanded that no more refugees be deported to Algeria. The North-African state is no longer able to protect those threatened by attacks, said Mr. Poppe to the "Frankfurter Rundschau" newspaper and that a big problem is that Germany does not recognise persecution by non-state agencies as valid grounds for granting asylum.
Still no clues regarding gravestone desecration

The police still have no leads on the culprits, twenty four hours after the desecration of the gravestone Mr. Galinksky, late chairman of the Central Jewish Committee in Germany. Unknown perpetrators had exploded a bomb on the memorial slab covering Mr. Galinksky's grave in the Berlin suburb of Charlottenburg yesterday. It is the second attack on the grave in the last few months. German president Roman Herzog condemned the attack. Mr. Bubis, president of the Central Jewish Committee, said that this attack was an attack on the Jewish community in Germany.
German Rail plans to cut InterRegio links

According to a report in the newspaper "Die Welt", German Rail have plans to either cut or severely limit InterRegio links from May 30th. This will affect train connections between Karlsruhe and Salzburg as well as between Saarbruecken and Lindau. German Rail tracks will also be more closely guarded using additional officers from the German Federal Guard after a series of attacks on railway lines.
